data.title: Soup and Sandwiches
data.text: Great local spot for a quick sandwich.  Loved the corned beef, but the ham is also amazing.  The split pea soups is just like home made.

data.title: The best soup/sandwich anywhere
data.text: My family members used to go here 20+ years ago. They took me here when we returned to town for a family funeral. SO GOOD. The service at the counter was warm, and genuine. We split a ham sandwich and got a soup each. The split pea was excellent and so was the bean soup. The ham sandwich was the best I've ever had. So simple and perfect. Good bread, awesome ham. We can't wait to return.. See you September 5th or 6th as we will be back in town then and we are not missing this place.

data.title: High quality ham sandwiches
data.text:
Premier quality ham piled high on an onion roll.  That's it.  Nothing else needed, but mustard.  Tastes great.  Also ordered a side of split pea soup, which was ok.  

This is my first visit.  I am pleased and would definitely come back for lunch.

data.title: A Classic
data.text: Once a month we make our trek to Lile's for Harry's ham sandwich served up with some fun banter from the ladies behind the counter.  (Ask for a Coke Zero!)  Always a treat.  Wish they made breakfast ... ham and eggs @ Lile's -- too good to imagine.

data.title: Best ham ever!
data.text: Stacked ham sandwiches on a onion roll, homemade ham and white bean soup an homemade split pea soup. Ham is baked in house. Whole ham can be purchased. A must!

data.title: Great ham sandwiches
data.text: This place has been a little known gem in Dearborn for years. Amazing fresh ham sandwiches on a roll. They even put an extra piece on top of the sandwich just so you get enough. Highly recommend you try this niche at least once

data.title: Arteries in my Corned Beef
data.text: Yes, it is a ham place, but I like corned beef. I tried it as a carryout. The corned beef was all fat and still had arteries in the served portion. It almost made me vomit. I cooked and served corned beef for years, so I do know a bit about the meat. They were closed when I called to complain. I will never return.

data.title: LILE'S A Hidden Gem:
data.text:
It a very small place,but has been around for years.
Famous for their Ham Sandwich on like a Kaiser Bun,and known for their Bean soup. Ham is on a "spindle" and twirling All day,it Very Good and Large portion. I like to save the other half for later on snack. Its about $6.00 for a sandwich,well worth it. you spend that at "fast food"down the street and get junk food!!!

data.title: "Some things never change...   and that can be a GOOD thing!"
data.text: Lile's delicious stacked ham sandwich is about as perfect as it gets.    I've been stopping in for lunch a couple times a year since I started working at Ford in 1978..  the quality and quantity remains constant = delicious!

data.title: Short and to the point!
data.text: If you are near Dearborn, MI or even if you are not, you NEED to visit this restaurant! 5 items on the menu! Corned Beef sandwich, Ham sandwich, and Turkey sandwich. Two soups, bean and split pea. This place reminds me of the restaurant in My Cousin's Vinny movie! Not a lot of choices, but the choices they have are amazing! Open 9:30am to 4:30pm Monday through Friday, closed on weekends. I had the Ham sandwich and bean soup and MAN OH MAN! I can hardly wait to visit again! I was almost in tears! Do NOT pass this place up!

data.title: Great food and friendly service
data.text: While the restaurant may be small and non-descript, the food is excellent and the service was very friendly.

data.title: The original Dearborn 'Fast Food'
data.text: You cannot judge a book by it's cover.  This place has only five items on their menu (not counting chips and soda's), Ham Sandwiches, Turkey Sandwiches, Corned Beef Sandwiches, and Pea Soup or Bean Soup ... 'That's all Folks!'  ... but the food is beyond belief.  City officials, police, lawyers, and dignataries line up for a mid-day taste.  The decor is paper plate and styrofoam.  Can you believe it gets rated?    The volume of customers at lunch tell the story.  If you go to any other 'fast food' within a mile you are not with the program.  Eat at Lile's while you can ... it may disappear when they move the City Hall and then it will only be a nostalgic memory.  Don't miss the opportunity.

data.title: Best Ham in Detroit
data.text: Freshly roasted Dearborn Ham served in the heart of Dearborn.  Harry Lile, son of founder, serves up awesome ham sandwiches stacked high with thick cuts of ham sliced right off the whole ham just over the counter.  jeesh, i sound like an advertisement.  Anyway, you can't beat fresh and juicy ham sandwich with a bonus piece of ham on top.  Both soups are great (split pea and navy bean) with chunks of ...you guessed it...Ham in them.  I drive the 20+ miles each way for lunch at least once a month and never regret it.  The staff is always frendly and having fun.  The atmosphere is 60's lunch counter, but fits perfectly with the 'straight up' great lunch.   A must try.  Scenic view is of Dearborn City Hall  :)

data.title: Industrial looking but tasty
data.text: On first glance I thought this place was a fabricating or repair shop it has a real utilitarian look you'd never think it was a restaurant. They only have a few items on the menu  which is fine with me because what they have is very good. I had the corned beef with a bag of chips and a soda for around 6 bucks. They keep some pickles in a tub on the counter along with mustard which I didn't notice till I was about finished. Definitely a place you want to hit when your in Dearborn

data.title: Great ham...
data.text: If you like Ham, this is the place to go.  You can also get Corned Beef, Turkey, and Roast Beef but Ham is the specialty. Their Navy Bean soup is also very good.

data.title: Good ham sandwiches
data.text: Very Spartan place.  Army mess halls have a lot more atmosphere than this place.  However, they serve very tasty ham sandwiches, corned beef sandwiches and pea soup for reasonable prices.  Want a bigger selection? Forget it! That's all they have!

data.title: Felt like we were on Seinfeld
data.text: Awesome sandwiches and soup.  The menu is limited to a couple o sandwiches, and a couple of soups.  Everyone in my group got the corned beef and we enjoyed it.  I wouldn't call the service friendly.... it was what reminded us of the soup restaurant on "Seinfeld".  Needless to say, we laughed alot during our visit, and I would go back again if I'm ever in Dearborn again.
